review:
The platform is fantastic, the built in code editor takes the hassle out of setting up your dev environment in VScode/IDE while you‚Äôre just getting into programming. Their customer service is amazing as well. Any time I‚Äôve had an issue they reply quickly and straight to the point. I started using Codecademy to prepare for a software development boot camp and I have to say, I was over prepared thanks to Codecademy. Their catalogue contains a WEALTH of knowledge, regardless of what discipline of software development you‚Äôre in. I recommend Codecademy to every person I meet who‚Äôs interested in programming or wants to brush up on their skills in the latest tech.
(p.s. The Pro membership is 100% worth it)

review:
I quote you guys ‚ÄúI mean pacifically those looking to learn any skills pertaining to the field software engineering and/or development a.k.a. ‚Äúholding ‚Äúwhich is a generalised vague summation of software development‚Ä¶I never understood the whole ‚Äúlearn to code‚Äù nonsense‚Äî because, ‚Äúcoding‚Äù in its broadest sense is nothing more than the execution of software‚Ä¶by that definition; anyone capable of running the following function in an IDE is a ‚Äúcoder‚Äù‚Ä¶

print(‚ÄòHello world‚Äô)

Grats!

When I first began learning software development, resources were limited to books and websites with personal blogs‚Ä¶before smart phones, using Windows ‚Äò99.

 I recently began ‚Äòlearning to code‚Äô (I get some more accurate explanation would be remembering to code whilst learning about what‚Äôs changed in almost 15Y‚Äî i‚Äôll admit it was a bit intimidating at first until I realise that just like always (at least when it comes to engineering/tech )Evolution is based in its simplest user friendly experience and so the UX/UI would be easy after a decade and a half of pivoting to finance for the 2nd half of my 20s. My goodness was I right.

I don‚Äôt know how to say this but python is a joke. In either case, I‚Äôve returned to home my craft and I am blessed with a bittersweet life.

I grew up with crippling OCD/autism/ADHD and so the syntax and indentation that really bugs most developers was something I actually enjoy it and C++/CSS.

I am/was uniquely poised for this whole fintech/crypto revolution‚ÄîNeedless to say there were NOT many people that have an educational tantamount to an MBA in finance and Master‚Äôs computer science which is exactly what you need to fully understand fintech. I feel really stupid for paying 300 something bucks for annual subscription at DataCamp when FCC is more than enough in terms of educational resources in Data science/data analysis/machine learning/etc. 

From a former MIT grad: shout-out to the devs at FCC for expediting access to your personal resources, fundamentals and exercises. At this rate I should be up to speed by the end of the quarter! Thanks to ya‚Äôll!

Respectfully,
-Ahmed T
title: You guys have no idea how lucky you have it‚Ä¶
